Package controller

Class AppController

java.lang.Object
controller.AppController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The AppController class manages the entire application's execution flow
Version:
June 16, 2024
Author:
Andrew Polyak

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AppController()
    The AppController constructor instantiates the DataController instance to manage data loading within AppController, as well as an ArrayList of Users which will contain the elements loaded by the DataController

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    getLoginSuccess()
    The getLoginSuccess method listens for a successful login, then calls the onUserLoggedIn method
    private void
    getMainMenuLogic()
    The getMainMenuLogic method instantiates instances of StartScreenController, LoginController, and RegisterController, then calls methods which listen for inputs on each of these screens
    void
    initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
    The initialize method loads the users database and manages the logic for the front end of the application (i.e., everything before the pre-game screen)
    private void
    onUserLoggedIn(User user)
    The onUserLoggedIn method creates a new PreGameController instance, and takes in a User instance brought over from the login attempt
    Pre-game screen inputs and interactions are then listened for
    If the user chooses to play pong, then the runPong method is called, passing in the user's username
    private void
    onUserRegistered(User user)
    The onUserRegistered method creates a new PreGameController instance, and takes in a User instance brought over from the register attempt
    Pre-game screen inputs and interactions are then listened for
    If the user chooses to play pong, then the runPong method is called, passing in the user's username
    private void
    runPong(String username)
    The runPong method creates a new PongGameController instance and PongMenuController instance, taking in the user's username to display in-game
    In-game menu inputs are listened for (i.e., forfeit, play again, back to menu)
    The pong game itself begins
    If the user chooses to play pong again, then the runPong method is internally called, passing in the user's username
    private void
    setAppLaunchView()
    The setAppLaunchView method makes the launch screen visible, but all other screens invisible

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • AppController

      public AppController()
      The AppController constructor instantiates the DataController instance to manage data loading within AppController, as well as an ArrayList of Users which will contain the elements loaded by the DataController

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      The initialize method loads the users database and manages the logic for the front end of the application (i.e., everything before the pre-game screen)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setAppLaunchView

      private void setAppLaunchView()
      The setAppLaunchView method makes the launch screen visible, but all other screens invisible

    • getMainMenuLogic

      private void getMainMenuLogic()
      The getMainMenuLogic method instantiates instances of StartScreenController, LoginController, and RegisterController, then calls methods which listen for inputs on each of these screens

    • getLoginSuccess

      private void getLoginSuccess()
      The getLoginSuccess method listens for a successful login, then calls the onUserLoggedIn method

    • onUserLoggedIn

      private void onUserLoggedIn(User user)
      The onUserLoggedIn method creates a new PreGameController instance, and takes in a User instance brought over from the login attempt
      Pre-game screen inputs and interactions are then listened for
      If the user chooses to play pong, then the runPong method is called, passing in the user's username
      Parameters:
      user -

    • onUserRegistered

      private void onUserRegistered(User user)
      The onUserRegistered method creates a new PreGameController instance, and takes in a User instance brought over from the register attempt
      Pre-game screen inputs and interactions are then listened for
      If the user chooses to play pong, then the runPong method is called, passing in the user's username
      Parameters:
      user -

    • runPong

      private void runPong(String username)
      The runPong method creates a new PongGameController instance and PongMenuController instance, taking in the user's username to display in-game
      In-game menu inputs are listened for (i.e., forfeit, play again, back to menu)
      The pong game itself begins
      If the user chooses to play pong again, then the runPong method is internally called, passing in the user's username
      Parameters:
      username -
